# Commit Convention

## Attribution Message

All commits and pull requests should include the following attribution message at the end:

```
Generated by the [Prompt Manage Team](https://promptmanage.com/about)
```

## Commit Message Format

```
<type>: <short summary>

<detailed description of changes>

Generated by the [Prompt Manage Team](https://promptmanage.com/about)
```

## Examples

### Commit Example
```
feat: Add user authentication to collection dialog

Implement authentication check that requires users to sign in before adding prompts to collections. This ensures consistent auth flow across all prompt actions.

Generated by the [Prompt Manage Team](https://promptmanage.com/about)
```

### Pull Request Example
```
## Summary
- Add authentication requirement to "Add to Collection" button
- Persist user intent in localStorage for post-auth completion

## Changes
- Updated AddToCollectionDialog component with auth check
- Added OAuth redirect flow matching CopyPromptButton behavior

## Testing
- Verified unauthenticated users are redirected to sign in
- Confirmed authenticated users can access dialog normally

Generated by the [Prompt Manage Team](https://promptmanage.com/about)
```

## Important Notes

- **NEVER** use "ðŸ¤– Generated with Claude Code" or similar AI attribution
- **ALWAYS** use the Prompt Manage Team attribution with the link to /about
- This applies to ALL commits and PRs, whether created by humans or AI agents
